history.text: I think Christian Bale did a great job as Batman in this movie.
Christian Bale was the best Batman, his demeanor totally sold the character.
Oh, absolutely, he did an amazing job portraying Batman/Wayne's damaged psyche
The cast of Batman Begins was really good.  Michael Caine as Alfred was a great choice also.  His British mannerism sold it on the whole comic scene.
Michael Caine and Morgan Freeman together in a Batman movie is really something special, too
You do not see Katie Holmes as much but is a shining star in her role.
I like when they start from the beginning as give the back story and re-build the characters.
I think my favorite thing about the movie, other than the casting, is that it has Ra's al Ghul in it
Scarecrow was pretty great, as well
There always needs to be a good vilian.
villian.
I'm glad they focused so much on Bruce's bat phobia. The well scene was top-notch
Liam Neeson almost looks like the Ra's al Ghul comic character.  He also has kind of a dark side.
The bat phobia totally goes with building the back story and character.
Gary Oldman definitely looks like Gordon.
The casting director surely worked on who they wanted.
Nolan's direction was just what the franchise needed
The franchise got dark in a non-comical way, and it really showed the grittiness of crime when Wayne was in prison
I liked the darkness of the movie.  It described the internal conflict of Bruce Wayne.
I loved the fight scene and the burning down of the temple in the beginning.  He totally went rogue.
I thought the ratings of the movie from rotten tomatoes was lower than it should be.
Metacritic was really off, if you ask me
I'm not usually much for superhero films, but this was worthy of an A
and yes, the League of Shadows was awesome
Yes, of all the batman movies this was an "A" in my book too.
I like that the villain starts of mundane with Falcone, then it gets really deep
They certainly built their characters.
it was pretty novel that the weapon for the villains was a microwave emitter

It is crazy how they built duality of action to non action and fate when it comes to good and evil.  Either you confront it immediately or it will seek you out later in life.  Falcone totally did this and it was kind of like that in spider man.
oh yes. and it was wonderful the film focused on corruption of powerful individuals, like Dr. Crane
Every super hero needs to show a small weakness and be saved by someone close to them to show how you can have some imperfections.
and or weaknesses.
Like how Rachel and Alfred both saved Bruce, from a mental and physical standpoint
they didn't just use comic-book archetypes, they made the characters real people
That is why this batman was kind of special and cheated on the ratings.

one has to wonder if Ra's was right about Gotham being corrupt and beyond saving. it's a good way of thinking of the world's current situation

There is always something worth saving.  There is always hope and everyone is not bad and/or evil.
he certainly came a long way from wanting to murder Joe Chill

and we need honest police like Gordon
That is a fact.  Internal struggles that everyone faces.

honestly, I think that the movie is meant to mirror our world, just as the burning of Ra's home and Bruce's home mirror each other
That is a great parallel.

good nod to the corrupt psychiatric industry, too. Doctors spraying fear-inducing chemicals and experimenting on patients
Over medicating the world as we live it now.  Kind of a dark look at our society in general.
